p.text: Coordinate Y of the object upper left edge.

p.textAll: Coordinates of all objects are arranged not like usual coordinates. The origin of coordinates is not in the left bottom edge, but in the left upper one. So the coordinate Y is nothing but a distance from the left edge.

remarks.text: If you placed an object inside of the other object (e.g. inside of a panel), then coordinates are calculated relative to this object (panel).

sample.sampletitle: Variants of how button coordinate Y can be set:
